availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Spence (McCracken County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and county clerk)

body.p: McCracken County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and county clerk. North Carolina native. Son of Elizabeth Spence. Married to Nancy Jane Moore Spence in McCracken County, Kentucky, on April 15, 1852. Father of Albert H. Spence, Malcolm G. Spence, Medora Spence, Eugene Spence, and William Spence. Schoolteacher in McCracken County in 1850. Schoolteacher in McCracken County in 1860. Clerk of the McCracken County Court in McCracken County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, p. 183A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 2, p. 838.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, p. 143B.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863, Legislative Document Series, No. 10 (Frankfort, KY: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 303.
"Judge James Spence Dead," Kentucky Advocate (Danville, KY), April 12, 1901, Newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/clip/86373884/.
Kentucky Marriage Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994046, McCracken County Marriages, p. 1.
